page.title: 04Tan-y-Groes/Sarnau, Dyfed
page.content: {Cereal farming }is not a very important source of income in the area. Some{barley and corn}is grown. mainly in the south in the valley bottom.{Rape}is becoming more popular, and{potatoes}are grown for home consumption, farm-gate sales, and animal feed.{Swede and turnip}are also grown. Due to mild wet climate{Silage} is made for over-wintering stock, and {Hay}produced in good summers. Farms vary in size from small-holdings of 12-20 acres, to mid-sized ones of 70 acres and a few larger cereal growing units in the south part. {Poultry}are kept for eggs for the farm, with a few {battery farms.}Pigs and goats are not often kept. Many farms have been sold, the land being bought by nearby farmers, and the farmhouses sold as residential or holiday accomodation.
